title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: A panel sits to inteview you and asks in depth bout your past research experience. Expect to answer questions that you should know with a BS or an MS degree.
Interview Questions: A panel sits to inteview you and asks in depth bout your past research experience. Expect to answer questions that you should know.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: it was good. we went through each basic interview question you would think plus about where you see your self in 5 years and about scenerios. so yes i dont know why this thing is making me type 30 words
Interview Questions: tell me a little about yourself?

title: Diagnostic Radiologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I met with several faculty radiologists and the resident program director. Delightful and smart people. Enjoyed a tour and saw a few residents. Overall, the experience came me a great overall impression.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Manegment Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Dirat round with vendoer screening round than with the implememtaion paetner and agtee that direct skype with the main client. Aftwe that they will send the laptop at your home. This is a remote poaition.
Interview Questions: How will you manage the tema?

title: Accreditation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty normal. Received a phone call to set up a meeting. The meeting invite was sent out for a zoom meeting.  Held over zoom with a large group at once instead of individual short meetings with multiple interviewers.
Interview Questions: They were pretty standard canned questions. Describe a difficult situation you had to manage, why are you looking for a job, ect

title: Project Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Not transparent at all, they will lead you on. Made it thru the first round and was told I'd be a great fit and would be contacted to schedule the second round eight hours later they sent a turn down email.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize tasks when you have multiple people tasking you?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: the interview was conducted via zoom and the interviewers were late. they didn't ask may questions, but spent the time introducing current projects and the duties of postdocs and the benefits of working there.
Interview Questions: have you had experience working with adults challenging behaviors

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Quite well, they offer you a warm welcome, we tour the area and the lab.  People are nice.  The building seems new. Not many students like other medical research centers located on college campuses.
Interview Questions: Tell me your background, do you know xxx techniques.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was similar to a job interview, it was straightforward and to the point. Answers to questions were not based on right or wrong. Also looked for relative experience or how they might benefit from you as the intern.
Interview Questions: What is your background and experience?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Lincoln, NE) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Good. Not challenging. Fine. Not a hard time. Good university. Not bad at all. Glad I attended. Will recommend to others. Happy to go back. Science is very important to them. Must have a good background in research.
Interview Questions: What author do you look up to?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screening that lasted for maybe fifteen minutes, and then a group interview with the department head as well as another individual that lasted about an hour and a half.
Interview Questions: Several behavioral questions--also the typical why us? Why you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was scheduled at a time that was on my available time.  I was told all details of how to get to the office. Who to ask for and directions on how to get to the company.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses

title: Digital Content/Asset Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was notified of their interest, and met with the department the following week. Interviewed with a four person panel (the team you would be working with) and then the head of the team in two separate interviews taking place one after another. Lasted about 90 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is UNMC's mission?

title: Clinical Allergy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was difficult and long process with mamu respecting questions. They also did not offer water or time to answer quesyiins from panel or one on one with the manager
Interview Questions: Name my strengths

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: streamlined including open house, individual interviews, group meetings, breakout rooms and allows virtual. good pay and provisional licensure. Great mix of autonomy and guidance throughout the year. Everyone who works here seems to like their job and made the interview comfortable
Interview Questions: where would you like to be in five years

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very nice and relaxing and the professor are really nice people, they try to understand your meaning since I am a international student. They talk about their opinion of the current research breakthrough and give me their experience when they were students.
Interview Questions: talk about the research details you did

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: First a video interview, followed by an in person interview  with the manager. You wait for a contact email from the department in regards to being interviewed in person a second time.
Interview Questions: Basis interview questions were given, pertaining to how well you would be an assest to the position given.

title: Insurance Adjustment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Laid Back, flowed very well.  Had plenty of things to talk about.  Offered the job on the spot unable to accept due to a pay cut I would be taking from my previous employer
Interview Questions: Something that sets you apart from your peers?

title: Md Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
excellent and was very stress free. Answered all questions with no hesitation and with no difficulty. 
This was not an easy task for me as was searching for fellowship jobs and was not going well with interview season.
Interview Questions: why you chose nephrology

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick, general interview questions, no tricky questions, professionalism. Discussed my past work experiences and background.  Asked about experiences at my other jobs where I had to use clinical judgement, critical thinking and act fast
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and cordial. Good grasp of subject material. Very good with details of the job. Very knowlegebale. Great people. Overall the interview process was an insight into the job and the team.
Interview Questions: Nothing in particular other than research.

title: Facilities Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was daily lengthy. Overall from applying to the first day was just over a month. The interview was with the Manager and the Three Shift leads. It was held in a conference room. Semi formal attire is required. You dont have to shave.
Interview Questions: How do work with a team and by yourself?

title: Histology Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
interview with hiring manger which took around 1 hour, total 12 questions.  
Then with director 1:1 takes 20 min. all the question is about personality. only one about technique.
Interview Questions: Tell me about you

title: Research Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: intervied with principal investigator, I was offered the job at the end of the interview, this may or may not have been a bad thing, i am not sure, but the job seemed to work out as long as i wanted to stay there, a lot of foreign language spoken made for hostile environment
Interview Questions: what are your strengths

title: Educational Projects Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I'd love to tell you how the interview went, except that the application portal rejected my application as soon as it was submitted. Disqualifying candidates based on an automated algorithm sounds like a great idea in theory, but by looking for unicorns who only have the exact key words you're looking for takes good talent out of your applicant pool. I wish I'd had the opportunity to interview for this position. I'd have loved to apply my skills and background towards the success of UNMC. Perhaps you should treat recruiting as it should be--a process of interpersonal communication and not automatic disqualification based on a computer algorithm. This is the problem with the hiring process today.
Interview Questions: Do you match the job description exactly so we don't have to train you at all?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person interview. Took a little over 2 weeks. Everyone was very friendly, more so interested as you as a person and your career goals and why you wanted the job.
Interview Questions: Nothing stood out - Career goals etc.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, panel interview, dean interview, additional interview.  Long process from initial submission of application to first call, then several weeks between each step.  Lengthy process, but this is standard for the majority of university positions.
Interview Questions: Questions related to experience and management of difficult employees; limited situational questions.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was whole day started 7am and ended around 4pm. There was a lunch break and 10-15 minutes between different interviewer. I met many people, were showed around and did one presentation.
Interview Questions: Q: when you can start working?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions:
1) Phone interview with hiring manager
2) In-person panel interview (4 panel members). 
3) In-person interview with Dean 
4) Final interview with Dean.  

Process took 11 weeks from application to offer.  
Traditional interview questions on panel.  

Tips:
Come prepared with questions, especially if interviewing with faculty.  
Be patient.  All hiring at the university level takes weeks longer than you would expect.  
Be passionate; this is good advice for any position/interview, but essential for work at UNMC.
Interview Questions: Traditional "Tell me about a time when..." or "How would you handle..." questions

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: Only HR interview and they were looking if you are a good fit for them and i think they were preferring MIS candidates over CS ones .They first contaced by phone and asked if you can work for them on a visa and said they may not sponsor any visa.How many hours you can work and asked if customer satisfaction is more important or programming challenge
Interview Questions: They were looking if you are a good fit fot them as they think graduate students can very much do the work

title: SURP Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: You'll have a two page research interests paper, one or two recommendation letters, transcripts from your school and high school test scores. The research interests paper is what really makes you stand out. This is where you tell them why UNMC and why you. It's good to have a concrete idea of what you'd like to study in the paper: too vague and they won't think that you really want to pursue that field. Put the effort in to read relevant research papers beforehand and mention them in your paper. Also mention previous research experience.
Interview Questions: You have to make sure that you have all of your shots and vaccinations or they won't accept you into the program

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic questions about what you did when you had a conflict, how you handle stressfull situations, ect.  Was allowed to ask my questions about the organization.  And was then told she was going have them offer me the job.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a conflict and how did you handle it?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: send the application email and be interviewed  and then asked to give oral presentation. Boss is nice and helpful. I gave them a oral presentation during the lab meeting,the boss ask me a lot of questions even the field is not he familiar with. It looks like boss knows science very well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Process took 2 weeks, was offered the job at the end of the interview. I do not expect anyone else to see that same result. This was an oddity to me.
Interview Questions: How much PCR experience do you have?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had telephonic interview which went great. I had one to one talk with the chair who describes me about the program and projects going in the department. Due to prior experience in research, he asked me the projects that I conducted over there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to PhD and why did you choose UNMC?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had contacted the department head by phone the previous year, but they did not have a position available. We kept in touch by email about every six months. She let me know when a postion was available. I completed an online application and she set up an interview
Interview Questions: The interview was more conversational than question/answer.

title: Research Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska Medical Center (Omaha, NE) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Online submission.
Initial contact by phone.
In person interview.
Interview Questions: Explain how you will be a good fit in this laboratory.
